definition[0]: someone who is responsible for looking after something important or valuable
example[0]: Farmers are custodians of the land for the next generation.
definition[1]: someone who looks after a public building
definition[2]: someone who is responsible for looking after something valuable for another person or for the public
example[2]: As the former custodian of Europeâ€™s strongest currency, the deutsche mark, the Bundesbank effectively dictated monetary policy across the Continent.
definition[3]: in the US, someone who represents the interests of a child and is responsible for looking after their money and property
example[3]: The custodian will manage the property if the gift giver dies before the child has reached the age of 21.
definition[4]: a financial institution that is responsible for looking after the assets of a mutual fund
